profile_data.summary:
Hi, I'm Maryam Nozari, an enthusiastic and motivated AI specialist with a passion for exploring how people and machines learn. Over the years, I've designed and deployed industry-leading algorithms and predictive models across diverse analytical data. I'm skilled at collaborating with cross-functional teams, implementing statistical modeling, and evaluating cutting-edge technology and software.

I've spent a significant part of my career studying how people learn, and now I'm exploring the fascinating world of machine learning and generative models. As a senior data scientist and consultant at Enterprise Knowledge, I specialize in semantic layers, recommendation engines, knowledge graph implementation, and advanced analytics platforms across industries like financial services, pharmaceuticals, and workforce enablement.

After completing my Ph.D. research, publishing several papers in peer-reviewed journals, and becoming an assistant professor, I decided to transition to the industry to apply my research and problem-solving skills to real-world business problems. I'm committed to building powerful predictive models and delivering actionable insights to drive impactful results for organizations.

I'm passionate about uncovering stories hidden in data and excited to bring my skills to companies striving to achieve and exceed their growth goals. Feel free to reach out if you'd like to learn more about how my expertise can help your company thrive.

My SKILLS include:

DATA SCIENCE:

• Predictive Modeling: Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Classification, Clustering, Decision Tree, Random Forest, Ensemble Methods
• Machine Learning: Recommendation Systems, Natural Language Processing(NLP), Large Language Model (LLM), Time Series Analysis, Image Processing, Deep Learning (TensorFlow, Keras), Neural Networks Architecture (CNN, Transfer Learning),  Feature Engineering,  Principal Component Analysis(PCA) Model Optimization (Grid Search, Random Search, Bayesian Optimization, Hyperparameter Tuning), Model Evaluation Metrics
• Big Data: Hadoop, Spark, Pyspark, Model Deployment
• Probability and Statistics: Hypothesis Testing, A/B Testing
• Data Visualization: Matplotlib, Seaborn, Story Telling
• Tools: APIs, MS Office (incl. Excel)

LANGUAGES
Python (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-Learn), SQL (Window Functions, Complex Joins, Nested Queries)

MANAGEMENT
Research project manager; Data management and analytics; Design and manage multi-year research projects and teams

AUTHOR & PRESENTER
Author of technical reports and public-facing publications
profile_data.headline: AI Specialist | Consultant | Women In Data Boston | Cloud Solutions Architect | Semantic Layer

experience.description:
•	Documenting and tracking key requirements and use cases for cross-functional stakeholders to ensure alignment with business objectives
•	Demonstrating expertise in Managed File Transfer Systems (MFTS) technologies and platforms, including Kiteworks, MOVEit, and IPSwitch and work with a wide range of MFTS systems and data encryption methods to support secure data transfer
•	Identify organizational challenges, develop effective procedures and processes, and present data-driven recommendations to executive teams
experience.title: Senior Data Scientist

experience.description:
• Leading a team of data scientists in the Marta Community Farmers Market Project at ATLytiCS, a data-driven organization focused on urban agriculture
• Developing and optimizing predictive models using feature selection algorithms for customer behavior analysis
• Analyzing large-scale data sets and employing loss functions and variance explanation techniques to compare performance metrics
• Implementing data workstreams and collaborating with cross-functional teams to promote collaborative data management efforts
• Conducting statistical analysis and data visualization to discern trends and patterns in customer behavior
• Collaborating with sales and marketing teams to align supply with demand and adjusting the supply chain as needed to meet changing customer needs
• Developing and maintaining metrics to track and analyze supply chain performance, identifying opportunities for improvement, and reporting progress to management
• Conducting statistical analyses and performing hypothesis testing
• Presenting findings and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders
experience.title: Lead Data Scientist

experience.description:
• Conduct research on the neurocognitive and genetic connections between reading and math using Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) and language, math, and cognitive assessments.
• Collaborate with a team of researchers to design and implement studies, collect and analyze data, and prepare manuscripts for publication
experience.title: Visiting Scholar

experience.description:
• Designed and executed projects to monitor intervention implementation across multiple schools, analyzed student performance data to identify areas for improvement.
• Conducted statistical analysis and data visualization on audio and video datasets to derive insights into student performance and identified areas for improvement.
• Developed and analyzed survey data to assess the social validity of various programs.
• Created data visualization dashboards to evaluate systematic progress monitoring data.
• Contributed to the evaluation of technology and software with internal and external partners.
• Collaborated with cross-functional teams to synthesize research into large-scale reports, contributed to the development of evidence-based policies.
• Presented findings at conferences and meetings
• Participated in grant writing and fundraising activities to secure funding for research projects
• Trained and supervised research assistants and graduate students
experience.title: Assistant Professor

publications.name: Enterprise AI Meets Access and Entitlement Challenges: A Framework for Securing Content and Data for AI
publications.description:
As organizations rapidly adopt AI technologies, the challenge of managing access control while maximizing AI capabilities becomes increasingly critical. In this article, I explore how modern access management frameworks can enhance AI systems' security without compromising innovation.

Key highlights:
AI-enhanced Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
Dynamic security frameworks that adapt to organizational needs
Practical strategies for balancing innovation with data protection

volunteer.description: Discover a space where learning, networking, and growth are at the core of membership. Explore our membership options tailored to meet diverse needs and aspirations.

I am grateful to be elected as the vice president of TCLD this year and am honored to work with such wonderful board members. I want to Thank all my friends and colleagues who supported me and voted for me. The Council for Learning Disabilities (CLD), an international organization composed of professionals who represent diverse disciplines, is committed to enhancing the education and quality of life for individuals with learning disabilities across their life-span. CLD accomplished this by promoting and disseminating evidence-based research and practices related to the education of individuals with learning disabilities. In addition, CLD foster (a) collaboration among professionals; (b) development leaders in the field; and (c) advocacy for policies that support individuals with learning disabilities at local, state, and national levels.
